name: treatment of waste natural gas, sweet, burned in production flare | waste natural gas, sweet | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/3956/documentation

This activity represents the burning of sweet natural gas in production flare. Flaring is the controlled and intentional burning of natural gas as part of production and processing ;of crude oil and natural gas. Reasons for flaring gas include for safety, disposal, lack of infrastructure for gas capture, storage and transmission, or due to low profitabilty (compared to crude petroleum oil). ;Flaring releases greenhouse gases like CO2, CH4, NOx and other gases like SO2 into the atmosphere. Following the approach of Meili et al. (2021), overall region-specific emission data for CH4, NOx and SO2 are provided in the main activities for the production of crude oil and natural gas (as described in chapters 9.2 and 9.5 in Meili et al., 2021). Only the remaining combustion gases released are estimated in this inventory for sweet gas treated by being burned in production flare.;Source: C. Meili, N. Jungbluth, M. Bussa (2021) Life cycle inventories of crude oil and natural gas extraction. ESU-services Ltd. commissioned by the Federal Office for the Environment (FOEN) and the â€œVerband der Schweizerischen Gasindustrie (VSG), Schaffhausen, Switzerland, DOI: 10.13140/RG.2.2.29142.78409, http://esu-services.ch/data/public-lci-reports/

Flaring losses of natural gas are modelled including the resource extraction from ground (which is not included in figures about natural gas production) and the emissions to air. (Meili et al. 2021)

Emissions from treatment of sweet natural gas in production flare.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/06:Extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas/062:Extraction of natural gas/0620:Extraction of natural gas

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The figures are an average for the data of 1999 and 2000, except for the NMVOC emissions, where no data for 2000 was available
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data is based on Norwegian environmental report.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Data is based on the Norwegian data (offshore combined production). No information on technology.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Norwegian data are assumed to be representative for standard flaring.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data is based on the annual reports on emissions and discharges submitted by each individual operator. The emissions and discharges are estimated according to guidelines given by the Norwegian authorities and OLF (Norwegian Oil Industry Association).
